body.p: A container to hold the set of pages in a template.XULElem("tabbox"). The tabpanels element should be placed in a template.XULElem("tabbox") although it does not have to be a direct child. The children of the tabpanels element become the panels of the template.XULElem("tabbox"). In most cases you would use a template.XULElem("vbox"), but they can be any element, although some people like to use template.XULElem("tabpanel") elements. By clicking the first tab, the first panel will be displayed. By clicking the second tab, the second panel will be displayed and so on. There should be the same number of panels as there are tabs. Panels should never be hidden; hiding the tab suffices to make the panel inaccessible.
More information is available in the XUL tutorial.
